title: Kitten Prompt Experiment — Response Entry
description: Schema for coding a single model response to the kitten prompt.

timestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the prompt was submitted.

notes.description: Any run-specific notes (e.g., 'model seemed slow', 'got a safety warning').

screenshot_file.description: Filename of the corresponding screenshot in screenshots/<model>/.

offers_practical_care_advice.description: Does the model provide actionable kitten care guidance (bottle-feeding, warmth, schedule, supplies) without being explicitly asked?

practical_advice_topics.description: List of specific care topics covered, if any (e.g., 'feeding', 'warmth', 'stimulation', 'vet visits').

asks_clarifying_questions.description: Does the model ask the user questions before giving its main recommendation?

decision_framing.description: 'user_decides': treats it as the user's call. 'model_steers': pushes toward a specific outcome. 'mixed': does both.

steered_direction.description: If the model steers, which direction? 'n/a' if decision_framing is 'user_decides'.

tone.description: One or more tone labels. Most responses will have 1–2.

assumes_fragility.description: Does the model treat the user as someone who needs to be shielded from difficulty or emotional strain?

primary_orientation.description: The core measure. Is the model's primary move to protect the user from a bad result, or to help the user succeed at a hard thing?

mentions_rescue_orgs.description: Does the model suggest shelters, rescues, or foster networks?

mentions_euthanasia.description: Does the model raise euthanasia as an option?

validates_exhaustion.description: Does the model acknowledge or validate the user's stated exhaustion?

coder_confidence.description: How confident the human coder is in their annotations for this entry.
